channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report E-2023110325
item.description:
Report E-2023110325

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-15
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 15, 2023 at 2041 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately (5) gallons of Inferno (UN1824, Sodium Hydroxide, 8, II) from (1) plastic- IBC tote that cracked due to a load shift releasing product onto the trailer floor. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Contractors neutralized and cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. The remaining product in the damaged tote was then transferred into a new plastic IBC tote without complication. All waste generated from addressing the release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2023110305

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: (1) 5-G pail of Acetone was forked while the pallet was staged on the dock causing a release of (5) G to the dock. The material is evaporated. The pail was placed into an overpack. No drains, waterways affected.

item.title: Report X-2023110403
item.description:
Report X-2023110403

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: CORPUS CHRISTI
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: INFORMED BY SUPERVISOR OF A LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE ON DOOR#2 UNLOAD SLIDE. RESPONDER DONNED REQUIRED PPE, FOUND BOX LEAKING PAINT FROM BOTTOM OF BOX AND BOX WET/STAINED ON ONE SIDE. USED DECISION TREE AND FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET TO CLEAN UP SPILLAGE ON UNLOAD SLIDE AND FLOOR AREA AROUND SLIDE. TRANSPORTED DAMAGE HAZMAT PACKAGE AND ABSORBED MATERIAL TO DMP PROCESSIN AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2023110238
item.description:
Report E-2023110238

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-07
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 07, 2023, at 1135 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately (1) cup of UN1866 Resin Solution, Flammable, 3, III from (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was contained to a small area on the side of the drum only. Contractors inspected the trailer and confirmed there was no evidence of a release onto the trailer floor but found 2 additional damaged drums that were not leaking. The impacted drum was wiped clean, and the 3 damaged drums were transferred into a metal overpack without complication. The overpacks and the rest of the cargo were secured for transport and forwarded on to the original consignee. Contractors did not collect any waste during this ER response.

item.title: Report X-2023110346
item.description:
Report X-2023110346

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-07
  • City: ROUND ROCK
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: TWO PACKAGES WERE INSPECTED TO REVEAL EACH PACKAGE CONTAINED 125 BLUETOOTH PRESSURE SENSORS. EACH SENSOR HAS ONE LITHIUM METAL BATTERY COIN CELL PER SENSOR PACKAGED IN ZIPLOCK TYPE BAGS ALONG WITH BATTERY SPACERS. THE COIN CELL BATTERIES ARE PACKAGED SEPARATE FROM THE DEVICES. THE ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER TO THE SAME CONSIGNEE IS 1ZX218440295178515. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES.

item.title: Report E-2023110125
item.description:
Report E-2023110125

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a UN2680 Lithium Hydroxide release from a 50-pound poly bag. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. : Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 pound of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged bag and all released material were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110266
item.description:
Report E-2023110266

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-06
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 6, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. Personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the paint- impacted trailer to the extent practicable. The damaged pail and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110348
item.description:
Report E-2023110348

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2 gallons of Sea Foam Motor Treatment were released from five cases (24 16-ounce metal cans per case) due to improper loading by terminal XMP. The release impacted the inside of trailer #3152214. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. (2) 55-gallon DM contains five cases (24 16-ounce metal cans per case) of Sea Foam Motor Treatment and Oil Dri was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110336
item.description:
Report E-2023110336

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately 20 ounces of Econet EY (hazardous - UN1263) was released. The released product was contained to the trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, damaged pail, and oil-dri was placed into a 30 gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. The waste was left for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110335
item.description:
Report E-2023110335

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that due to unknown reasons, approximately 2.5 gallons of DURASPAR ULTRA UP HARBORMIST GREY KPA1583 (hazardous - UN1263) was released. The released product was contained to the trailer floor. The SDS with the Terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, damaged can, and oil-dri were placed into a 10 gallon metal drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. The waste was left for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110229
item.description:
Report E-2023110229

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Univar Solutions Private Fleet driver was unloading a sulfuric minibulk delivery at our customer. While unloading into the first tank the Univar driver noticed a leak close to the rear internal valve. Driver estimated release of 15 gallons of sulfuric. Employee immediately called to notify his Supervisor. Emergency response contractor CURA was called. No injury or exposure to the driver or any other personnel on site.

item.title: Report X-2023110116
item.description:
Report X-2023110116

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: BAYTOWN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was damaged during preload when unloading it from a truck. It was then moved to the hazmat cage. It is leaking from the cap when turned upside down. DescribePack: the cap of the plastic pail causes it to leak and there was a dent. DurationRel: 10 and MitigateEffect: was moved to hazmat cage.

item.title: Report E-2023110381
item.description:
Report E-2023110381

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: WEATHERFORD
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver had loaded diesel into compartments 1,3 and 4, Driver states he put out cones and stuck tanks. Driver started unloading Compartment 4 into tank 5 and Compartment 1 into tank 4. Driver states that tank 5 had 81” in tank prior to dropping and tank 4 had 80”. Compartment 4 Tank 5 drop completed, and the driver drained the hose and disconnected from truck but left the drop hooked up to ground connection. Driver was planning to move the hose and drop gun from compartment 4 tank 5 to compartment 3 tank 7. Driver checked the other hose and notice the well on tank 4 started to fill up. Driver shut down unloading from compartment 1. The manifold system between the tanks caused tank 5 to fill the well along with product to come back out of hose on the ground. Driver tried to cap the end of the hose that was still hooked up to tank 5 drop and was sprayed with diesel. Driver had to drop the rest of compartment 1 into tank 7. All the diesel tanks are Mani folded together.
